para.text: HOB - Head-Observation Package

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: HOB
Purpose
The Head-Observation input file is used to specify observations of head for use in the Observation process.
Documentation

li.link: Hill, M.C., Banta, E.R., Harbaugh, A.W., and Anderman, E.R., 2000, MODFLOW-2000, the U.S. Geological Survey modular ground-water model -- User guide to the Observation, Sensitivity, and Parameter-Estimation Processes and three post-processing programs: U.S. Geological Survey Open-File Report 00-184, 210 p.

para.text: Related Packages
input files
Supported in
Input Instructions
Input for the Head-Observation input file is read from a file that is specified with "HOB" as the file type in the

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Data Set 0
[#Text]
Item 0 is optional and can include as many lines as desired. Each line needs to begin with the “#” character in the first column.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Text—is a character string (maximum of 79 characters) that starts in column 2. Any characters can be included in Text. The “#” character needs to be in column 1. Text is printed when the file is read and provides an opportunity for the user to include information about the model both in the input file and the associated output file.
Data Set 1

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: MODFLOW-2000:
NH MOBS MAXM (free format)
MODFLOW-2005:
NH MOBS MAXM IUHOBSV HOBDRY
[NOPRINT]
(free format)
MODFLOW-CFP, MODFLOW-NWT, MODFLOW-OWHM, and MODFLOW-LGR:
NH MOBS MAXM IUHOBSV HOBDRY (free format)

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NH—is the number of head (or change in head) observations.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: MOBS—is the number of the NH observations that are multilayer.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: MAXM—is the maximum number of layers used for any of the MOBS observations.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IUHOBSV—File unit for saving observation data in a file. Specify 0 for no observation output file. The file for this unit must be included as type “DATA” in the Name File.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: HOBDRY—is the value of the simulated equivalent that is written into the observation output file (file unit IUHOBSV) when the observation is omitted because a cell is dry.
NOPRINT
—is an option keyword that turns off printing of input and output data in the Listing File.
Data Set 2

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: MODFLOW-2000:
TOMULTH EVH (free format)
MODFLOW-2005, MODFLOW-CFP, MODFLOW-NWT, MODFLOW-OWHM, and MODFLOW-LGR:
TOMULTH

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: TOMULTH—is the time-offset multiplier for head observations [-- or T/T]. The product of TOMULTH and
must produce a time value in units consistent with other model input. TOMULTH can be dimensionless or can be used to convert the units of
to the time unit used in the simulation.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: EVH—is the input error variance multiplier for hydraulic-head observations and is used to calculate the weights as described below in the calculation of
. EVH makes it easy to change the weights uniformly for all hydraulic-head observations.
Read sufficient repetitions of item 3 and, optionally, items 4 through 6 to obtain
head or change-in-head observations.
Data Set 3

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: MODFLOW-2000:
OBSNAM LAYER ROW COLUMN IREFSP TOFFSET ROFF COFF HOBS STATISTIC STAT-FLAG PLOT-SYMBOL (free format)
MODFLOW-2005, MODFLOW-CFP, MODFLOW-NWT, MODFLOW-OWHM, and MODFLOW-LGR:
OBSNAM LAYER ROW COLUMN IREFSP TOFFSET ROFF COFF HOBS (free format)
If LAYER is less than zero, hydraulic heads from multiple layers are combined to calculate a simulated value. The number of layers equals the absolute value of LAYER, or |LAYER|.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: LAYER—is the layer index of the cell in which the head observation is located. If LAYER is less than zero, hydraulic heads from multiple layers are combined to calculate a simulated value. The number of layers equals the absolute value of LAYER, or |LAYER|.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: ROW—is the row index of the cell in which the head observation is located.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: COLUMN—is the column index of the cell in which the head observation is located.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: ROFF—is the row offset used to locate the observation within a finite-difference cell (fig. 2).
If the absolute value of ROFF is less than 0.001, ROFF is changed to 0.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: COFF—is the column offset used to locate the observation within a finite-difference cell (fig. 2).
If the absolute value of COFF is less than 0.001, COFF is changed to 0.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: STATISTIC—is the value from which the observation weight is calculated as determined using STAT-FLAG.
Data Set 4
MLAY(1), PR(1), MLAY(2), PR(2), ..., MLAY(|LAYER|), PR(|LAYER|) (free format)
Sufficient repetitions of item 4 are read to define the contributions from each layer. The order of the layers needs to be specified according to the method presented in figure 4.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: MLAY(I)—is the I'th layer number for a multilayer head observation.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: PR(I)—is the proportion of the simulated hydraulic head in layer MLAY(I) that is used to calculate simulated multilayer head. The sum of all PR values for a given observation needs to equal 1.0.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Data Set 5
ITT (free format)
If
in item 3 is less than zero, read item 5.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: ITT—is a flag that identifies whether head or changes in head are to be used as observations.

li.text: ITT = 1: The observed hydraulic heads are used as observations.

ITT = 2: The initial observed hydraulic head and subsequent changes in head (for example, drawdown) are used as observations. Changes in head are calculated internally from the hydraulic-head values listed in item 6, so the
values specified in item 6 need to be hydraulic heads.

para.text: Data Set 6

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: MODFLOW-2000:
OBSNAM IREFSP TOFFSET HOBS STATh STATdd STAT-FLAG PLOT-SYMBOL (free format)
MODFLOW-2005, MODFLOW-CFP, MODFLOW-NWT, MODFLOW-OWHM, and MODFLOW-LGR:
OBSNAM IREFSP TOFFSET HOBS (free format)
If
in item 3 is less than zero, read item 6 for each of
observation times

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: STATh—is the value from which the weight is calculated if the observation is hydraulic head. STAT-FLAG is used to identify what STATh is and how the weight is calculated, as for

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: STATdd—is the value from which the weight is calculated if the observation is the temporal change in hydraulic head. STAT-FLAG is used to identify what STATdd is and how the weight is calculated, as for
